com.hush.hee
Class HushEncryptionEngineCore

java.lang.Object
  com.hush.hee.HushEncryptionEngineCore
All Implemented Interfaces:
SecureRandomCallback, PgpConstants, java.io.Serializable
public class HushEncryptionEngineCore
extends java.lang.Object
implements PgpConstants, java.io.Serializable, SecureRandomCallback

This provides the core functionality for the HushEncryptionEngine.
Do NOT add convenience access methods to this class. The "easy" interface should be on whatever class wraps this one. -sbs
Note on character encodings: aliases, email addresses, and passphrases are always assumed to be UTF-8. ASCII armored data is assumed to be ASCII. Actual data is always in byte array form, so no need to worry about converting that in this class.

See Also:
Serialized Form

authenticate

public int authenticate(java.lang.String alias,
                        byte[] passphrase)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        KeyStoreException,
                        UnrecoverableKeyException
Attempt to authenticate to retrieve private keys and random seed data from the Hush Key Server Network.

Parameters:
alias - The alias to attempt to authenticate.
passphrase - The passphrase for this alias
Returns:
SUCCESS (BAD_PASSPHRASE is deprecated, catch an UnrecoverableKeyException instead)
Throws:
UnrecoverableKeyException - if there was a bad passphrase
java.io.IOException - if there was an error communicating with the Key Server
DataFormatException - if badly formatted data was returned from the Key Server
KeyStoreException - if there was any other sort of error retrieving the keys

canonicalizePassphrase

public char[] canonicalizePassphrase(char[] passphrase)
Use char arrays to allow maximum flexibility for clearing the array in situations where that might be appropriate.

Warning, this does not support the Unicode "supplemental characters". See http://www.unicode.org/glossary/.

changeLoginCredentials

public void changeLoginCredentials(java.lang.String oldPassword,
                                   java.lang.String newUsername,
                                   java.lang.String newPassword,
                                   java.lang.String newHostname)
                            throws KeyStoreException
Deprecated. 

A method to change login credentials on the Hush Key Server Network. Authentication is accomplished using the current login credentials password, which can be retrieved through the getLoginCredentials method.

Note that if any old information is to be kept, it must be re-added here.

Parameters:
oldPassword - the original password
newUsername - the username to be stored
newPassword - the password to be stored
newHostname - the hostname to be stored
Throws:
KeyStoreException

changePassphrase

public java.lang.String[] changePassphrase(java.lang.String alias,
                                           byte[] oldPassphrase,
                                           byte[] newPassphrase)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           KeyStoreException,
                                           UnrecoverableKeyException
Attempt to change the passphrase of the given alias. This method will then authenticate as the changed user, unless some other user is already authenticated.

Parameters:
alias - the alias to change the passphrase for
oldPassphrase - the current passphrase for this alias
newPassphrase - the new passphrase for this alias
Returns:
the new passphrase shadows or null if N/A
Throws:
UnrecoverableKeyException - if there was a bad passphrase
java.io.IOException - if there was an error communicating with the Key Server
DataFormatException - if badly formatted data was returned from the Key Server
KeyStoreException - if there was any other sort of error retrieving the keys

checkAliasAvailability

public boolean checkAliasAvailability(java.lang.String alias)
                               throws KeyStoreException
Check to see if an alias is available on the Key Server Network. Should be called be creating a key record.

Parameters:
alias - the alias to check the availability of
Returns:
true if the alias is available, false if it is not
Throws:
KeyStoreException

checkForCertificates

public java.util.Vector checkForCertificates(java.util.Vector aliases)
Checks to see if certificates are available for the aliases passed in the Vector.

Parameters:
aliases - a list of aliases to check
Returns:
a Vector of aliases for which no public keys were found

copyUrlToFile

public java.lang.String copyUrlToFile(java.lang.String url,
                                      java.lang.String filepath,
                                      byte[] password,
                                      java.util.Hashtable parameters,
                                      int mode,
                                      java.util.Hashtable form,
                                      boolean decrypt,
                                      java.lang.String signature,
                                      java.util.Vector validSigners,
                                      java.util.Vector invalidSigners)
                               throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      KeyStoreException,
                                      DataFormatException,
                                      NoSessionKeyException,
                                      IntegrityCheckFailureException
Connect to a specified URL and copy the contents to a file, decrypting it if that operation is requested.
If a ".asc" filename is specified and the data is encrypted, the file will be renamed without the extension, unless a file with that name already exists.

Parameters:
url - the URL to retrieve
filepath - the location to save the URL contents
password - attempt to symmetrically decrypt the URL data with this password
symmetric - attempt symmetric decryption
mode - HTTP_GET or HTTP_POST
form - a form to send to the URL, as a set of key/value pairs
decrypt - attempt decryption
Returns:
the full path to the file in which the data is stored
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
java.io.IOException
KeyStoreException
DataFormatException
NoSessionKeyException
IntegrityCheckFailureException

createKeyRecord

public java.lang.String[] createKeyRecord(java.lang.String alias,
                                          byte[] passphrase,
                                          boolean useSharedSecret,
                                          java.lang.String preActivationCode)
                                   throws KeyStoreException,
                                          UnrecoverableKeyException
This method should be called after collectEntropy to create keys for an alias and passphrase.

Parameters:
alias - the alias to create keys for.
passphrase - the passphrase for this alias.
useSharedSecret - whether the passphrase should be split between three parties.
preActivationCode - the one-time use code required to create the account (for identity-binding purposes)
Returns:
passphrase shadows, or null
Throws:
KeyStoreException
UnrecoverableKeyException

createKeyRecord

public java.lang.String[] createKeyRecord(java.lang.String alias,
                                          byte[] passphrase,
                                          boolean useSharedSecret,
                                          java.lang.String preActivationCode,
                                          java.lang.String encryptionMethod)
                                   throws KeyStoreException,
                                          UnrecoverableKeyException
This method should be called after collectEntropy to create keys for an alias and passphrase. This method will not authenticate as the newly created user. If some other user is already authenticated, that user will remain authenticated.

Parameters:
alias - the alias to create keys for.
passphrase - the passphrase for this alias.
useSharedSecret - whether the passphrase should be split between three parties.
preActivationCode - the one-time use code required to create the account (for identity-binding purposes)
encryptionMethod - the method of encryption to use with this public key - can be one of "Normal" (recommended), "Web" (for Hushmail Express-style encryption), or "None" (do not encrypt).
Returns:
passphrase shadows, or null
Throws:
KeyStoreException
UnrecoverableKeyException

decrypt

public byte[] decrypt(byte[] toDecrypt,

canEncrypt

public java.lang.String[] canEncrypt(java.lang.String[] recipientAliases)
                              throws KeyStoreException,
                                     java.io.IOException,
                                     InvalidSignatureException,
                                     MissingSelfSignatureException
This method determines is a wrapper on canEncrypt(SecureMessage) which assumes that the only information passed in the SecureMessage will be recipient aliases.

Parameters:
recipientAliases - An array of aliases to wchih a message should be encrypted
Returns:
An array of recipients who do not have keys or the ability to use generated passwords
Throws:
KeyStoreException
java.io.IOException
InvalidSignatureException
MissingSelfSignatureException

canEncrypt

public java.lang.String[] canEncrypt(SecureMessage message)
                              throws KeyStoreException,
                                     java.io.IOException,
                                     InvalidSignatureException,
                                     MissingSelfSignatureException
This method determines which recipients of a SecureMessage do not have encryption keys or the ability to use generated passwords. These recipients will require passwords or questions and answers to be supplied. This *will* modify the recipients list of the SecureMessage, removing any recipients to whom the message cannot be encrypted.

Parameters:
message - The SecureMessage to encrypt
Returns:
An array of recipients who do not have keys or the ability to use generated passwords
Throws:
KeyStoreException
java.io.IOException
InvalidSignatureException
DeniedException - a user is not enabled for encryption
MissingSelfSignatureException

                                 throws KeyStoreException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        InvalidSignatureException,
                                        MissingSelfSignatureException

Parameters:
recipientAliases - An array of aliases to wchih a message should be encrypted
Returns:
An object indicating which recipients have encryption methods, which do not, and which are denied encryption
Throws:
KeyStoreException
java.io.IOException

MissingSelfSignatureException

generatePassword

public java.lang.String generatePassword()
Generate a strong random password. To be used in conjunction with the passwordEncryptFile() method. Generate a random password, encrypt a file with it, and then public key encrypt the password. Then, in order to share the file with new recipients, it is only necessary to re-encrypt the password, not the entire file.

Returns:
the password

recoverPassphrase

public byte[] recoverPassphrase(java.lang.String alias,
                                java.lang.String component)
                         throws KeyStoreException
Recover a passphrase. If the passphrase is split between the user, the customer and Hush, this method will recover a lost passphrase by supplying either the component held by the user or the customer.

Parameters:
alias - java.lang.String Alias to recover passphrase for.
component - java.lang.String Hexencoded component supplied.
Returns:
String The passphrase recovered.
Throws:
KeyStoreException

sendFileToUrl

public void sendFileToUrl(java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String filepath,
                          SecureMessage message,
                          java.lang.String fileParameterName,
                          java.util.Hashtable form,
                          long sizeLimit,
                          boolean sign,
                          java.lang.String signatureParameterName,
                          boolean forceEncrypt)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          KeyStoreException,
                          java.net.MalformedURLException,
                          NoEncryptionMethodException
Uploads a file to a URL by HTTP POST, with the option of encryption.

Parameters:
url - the URL to which the file will be posted
filepath - the path the the file to be uploaded
aliases - encrypt the file to these public keys (may be null)
password - encrypt the file with this password (may be null)
fileParameterName - the form variable in which the file will be placed
form - parameters to POST
sizeLimit - the maximum size for a POST request
sign - sign the file with the current private key
signatureParameterName - the form variable in which the signature will be placed
forceEncrypt - if neither aliases nor password are specified, throw an exception (don't send plain text)
Throws:
java.io.IOException
KeyStoreException
java.net.MalformedURLException
NoEncryptionMethodException

setAnonymous

public void setAnonymous(boolean anonymous)
When anonymous is true, no identifying information will be placed in outgoing encrypted messages, so they are suitable for BCC-ed messages. Setting this property affects only non-SecureMessage methods. SecureMessage methods ignore this property and use the corresponding property on SecureMessage.

Parameters:
anonymous - true or false (defaults to false)

generateSignatures

public void generateSignatures(SecureMessage message)
                        throws KeyStoreException,
                               java.io.IOException
Perform the signing operation, generating signatures without modifying the output. If getOutputStream() is not null, the unmodified message is written to that stream. Otherwise, output is not written at all.

After completion, the onePassSignatures property on the SecureMessage will be populated.

Parameters:
message - The message to sign
Throws:
KeyStoreException
java.io.IOException

updateRandom

public void updateRandom(java.lang.Object[] input)
Used to feed all available data into the PRNG. Note that it's fine to feed private data such as passphrases, private keys, etc., because all this data will be unrecoverable.

Parameters:
input - an array of Objects to convert to bytes or strings and feed to the PRNG

useArmor

public void useArmor(boolean useArmor)
Indicate whether or not the file encryption operations should use ASCII armoring. ASCII armoring will base-64 encode the encrypted data and add headers and footers indicating the message type. It will increase the size of the file, and reduce the speed of the encryption and decryption processes. ASCII armoring is off by default. Setting this property affects only non-SecureMessage methods. SecureMessage methods ignore this property and use the corresponding property on SecureMessage.

Parameters:
useArmor - true to turn armoring on, false to turn it off

useProgressIndicators

public void useProgressIndicators(boolean on)
Turn on or off graphical progress indicators.

Parameters:
on -

usesArmor

public boolean usesArmor()
Indicates whether ASCII armoring for encryption to files is on or off. Setting this property affects only non-SecureMessage methods. SecureMessage methods ignore this property and use the corresponding property on SecureMessage.

Returns:
true if armoring is on, false if it is off

verifyBinaryData

public int verifyBinaryData(java.lang.String signer,
                            java.io.InputStream dataStream,
                            java.lang.String signature,
                            java.util.Vector validSigners,
                            java.util.Vector invalidSigners)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            DataFormatException,
                            KeyStoreException
Verifies a signature against binary data read from a stream.

Parameters:
signer - a specific signer to check the signature for, or null to check all signatures [in]
dataStream - a stream to the data to verify [in]
signature - the signature to verify [in]
validSigners - a list of the verified signers [out]
invalidSigners - a list of signers whose signatures did not verify [out]
Returns:
SIGNATURE_VALID, SIGNATURE_INVALID, or NO_CERTIFICATE_FOUND; NO_CERTIFICATE_FOUND will override SIGNATURE_INVALID
Throws:
java.io.IOException
DataFormatException
KeyStoreException

verifyCleartextSignedMessage

public int verifyCleartextSignedMessage(java.lang.String signer,
                                        java.lang.String signedMessage,
                                        java.util.Vector validSigners,
                                        java.util.Vector invalidSigners,
                                        java.lang.String[] content,
                                        java.lang.String characterEncoding)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        DataFormatException,
                                        KeyStoreException
Verifies a signature against a text string. The string will be decoded using UTF-8 or the character encoding specified in the signature.

Parameters:
signer - a specific signer to check the signature for, or null to check all signatures [in]
signedMessage - the text and signature to verify [in]
validSigners - a list of the verified signers [out]
invalidSigners - a list of signers whose signatures did not verify [out]
content - the text without the signature will be placed in the first element of this array [out]
Returns:
SIGNATURE_VALID, SIGNATURE_INVALID, or NO_CERTIFICATE_FOUND; NO_CERTIFICATE_FOUND will override SIGNATURE_INVALID
Throws:
java.io.IOException
DataFormatException
KeyStoreException
